segments.text: I want to go house shopping , and I want to know what I can afford to buy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There is a formula that can help us figure that out . What is your annual salary ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I earn sixty-five thousand dollars per year .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What is the length of time that you have worked at the job you have now ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I have been at the job I now have for 2 years , and I have been with the company for 6 years total .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you receive any other income ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I own a small rental unit with a partner , and I receive five hundred dollars a month from that unit .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you know what your credit score is ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don â€™ t know , but the last time I checked , it was very good !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You are in good shape . Figuring in your other expenses , you can easily afford a house costing seven hundred thousand or maybe even a little more !
segments.speaker: S2
